meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After a few days in the mountains, she acclimatised to the thin air.
meanings.sent2: The tropical bird acclimatised quickly to the cooler weather in the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to acclimatise to the desert but realized it was a mistake.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he acclimatised to any situation effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: She acclimatised to the bustling city life as if she had lived there her whole life.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The new student acclimatised to the school routine within a week.
meanings.sent2: He acclimatised to the fast-paced work environment after a few days.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to acclimatise to human emotions but found it challenging.
meanings.sent4: She acclimatised to the chaos of the city like a seasoned traveler.
meanings.sent5: The plant acclimatised to the shade by growing taller to reach the sunlight.
